page.title: 02Farming around Johnstone
page.content: The bulk of the farming around Johnstone is centered on beef production with some sheep and a dairy.Most produce is sold locally at Paisley market and the milk goes to the Milk Marketing Board.Most crops grown in the area are used for winter feeding for the livestock although a lot still has to be bought in. The introduction of milk quotas in 1984 is still a cause of great concern in the farming community. Having been encouraged to produce more milk by cash rewards the EEC has now introduced quotas to restrict milk production, and this threat now looms over other sectors of farming.
